item.title: Dubai World Central is pleased to welcome partnerships between the UAE and Japan through the Japan Trade Centre
item.description: Source: Dubai World Central. Khalid Abdulla, Vice President, Licensing, Registration & Permits Approval, Dubai World Central, Usama Saleh, Vice President, Land Planning and Development, Dubai World Central, with Shogo Ishida, Director, JTC DWC LLC, during the inauguration of the Japan Trade Centre at Dubai World Central in January 2015. The Japan Trade Centre (JTC), a private business-to-business platform promoting Japanese small and medium enterprises (SMEs) internationally, is now operational at Dubai World Central (DWC)’s Business Park.

item.title: The HKTDC fairs for gifts, premiums, printing, and packaging draw in more than 60,000 buyers
item.description: Source: HKTDC. The 31st edition of the Hong Kong Gifts & Premium Fair and the 11th Hong Kong International Printing & Packaging Fair drew over 60,000 attendees from 134 countries and regions, according to the Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC). The Gifts Fair welcomed approximately 50,000 visitors, while the Printing & Packaging Fair saw over 14,000 attendees. Notably, there was increased participation from mainland China, Malaysia, the Philippines, and Indonesia.

item.title: Singapore and Jiangsu strengthen economic ties
item.description: The Singapore-Jiangsu Cooperation Council (SJCC) aims to boost opportunities for companies from both regions in areas like collaboration in third-party markets, trade and logistics, and financial services. This contributes to the existing Singapore-Jiangsu economic partnership and advances the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). Thirteen memoranda of understanding (MoUs) reflect these goals. Singapore’s Finance Minister, Heng Swee Keat, who is also SJCC Co-Chairman, emphasized the strong, enduring relationship between Singapore and Jiangsu.

item.title: Globebill is establishing a payment and bank card settlement system in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Globebill, a global online payment company, has partnered with Saudi Arabia to establish cross-border trade settlement services. This initiative aligns with China’s “One Belt and One Road” project. Through this partnership, Globebill will introduce a payment and bank card settlement system in Saudi Arabia. This system will issue credit cards to individuals and businesses, facilitating trade between China and Saudi Arabia through Globebill’s platform. Both entities will collaborate to promote Globebill’s payment and settlement services, including the issuance of personal and corporate credit cards across the Middle East and North Africa.

item.title: EY identifies obstacles that are impeding the effectiveness of the AEC
item.description: Political, legal, and organizational difficulties, regulatory burdens, and a lack of standardized trade regulations among ASEAN nations are hindering the progress of the 2007 ASEAN Economic Community (AEC) Blueprint. This plan aims to achieve regional economic integration by 2015, according to EY. A recent EY report, “Trade Secrets: ASEAN economic community and inward investment,” examines the AEC’s development from a business standpoint, specifically focusing on obstacles to conducting business within ASEAN.

item.title: The EU-Asean Business Council has introduced a new agenda aimed at increasing trade between ASEAN and the EU
item.description: The EU-ASEAN Business Council (ABC), the leading advocate for European businesses operating in the ASEAN region, has proposed several actions to strengthen trade and investment ties between ASEAN and the EU. These recommendations were released to coincide with the 26th ASEAN Summit held in Malaysia. The Agenda for the promotion of trade and investment between ASEAN and Europe was presented to ASEAN Economic Ministers and EU Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmström on April 26 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

item.title: Singapore and Kazakhstan are working together to enhance their bilateral trade relationship
item.description: Singapore and Kazakhstan have signed a bilateral investment treaty designed to encourage greater investment between the two nations. This agreement is intended to safeguard investors from both Singapore and Kazakhstan, giving them more confidence to pursue investment opportunities in each other’s countries. The treaty ensures that Singaporean companies operating in Kazakhstan will have additional protection for their investments beyond what is provided by Kazakhstan’s domestic laws, and the same applies to Kazakh companies in Singapore.

item.title: The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry has established a new office in Shanghai
item.description: To capitalize on promising markets and solidify Dubai’s position as a global business hub, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry has established its seventh international office in Shanghai, China. His Excellency Hisham Al Shirawi, Second Vice-Chairman of Dubai Chamber, emphasized China’s significance as Dubai’s top trading partner and highlighted the Chamber’s decade-long dedication to fostering strong trade relations. The Shanghai office, Dubai Chamber’s first in China, reflects this commitment and aligns with the Dubai Plan 2021’s goal of bolstering Dubai’s status as a leading business and investment destination.

item.title: IE Singapore has announced a new initiative to assist the trading sector in digitalizing. Additionally, IE Singapore will be merging with SPRING
item.description: Singapore’s Minister for Trade and Industry has launched the Wholesale Trade Industry Transformation Map (ITM) at an event focused on digitalizing trade. This initiative aims to boost the industry’s global growth and productivity, with a target of 10,000 new jobs by 2020. The wholesale trade industry is a significant contributor to Singapore’s economy, employing 9% of the workforce and contributing 12% to the nation’s GDP in 2016. While positioned for growth due to increasing demand in Asia, the industry is vulnerable to global shifts like rising protectionism and technological advancements.

item.title: Discover the enchantment of port cities at the Asian Civilisations Museum
item.description: Source: ACM website. A view of Singapore from Mount Wallich, painted in 1856 by Percy Carpenter, is one of the pieces displayed at the Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 exhibition. Port cities are vibrant hubs where people from diverse backgrounds converge, bringing with them a rich tapestry of goods and ideas. The special exhibition Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 at the Asian Civilisations Museum offers a glimpse into this fascinating world through various mediums including photographs, paintings, textiles, luxury items, and everyday objects.

item.title: The winners of the SME Exporter of the Month award were honored by the Dubai Chamber of Commerce
item.description: The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry recently acknowledged member companies for their exceptional export achievements during the first nine months of 2016. Nine trading companies received recognition at the “SME Exporter of the Month” ceremony: Universal International, Moon Flor General Trading, Signature Snacks, Al Khoud Trading, Raheeq Alasal Trading, Rais Hassan Saadi Logistics, Orient Links Co, Mohamed Abdulrahman Al Bahar, and Rayhan Al Sharq General Trading. These companies were celebrated for excelling in categories such as highest export value, most export markets served, highest number of certificates of origin issued, and highest export value achieved by a start-up within a specific month.
